headline: Is Citigroup’s (C) Funding Shuffle Quietly Rewriting Its Institutional Banking Playbook?
summary: Citigroup recently redeemed all US$1.50 billion of its 4.000% Fixed Rate Reset Noncumulative Preferred Stock Series W, while actively issuing a range of new callable senior unsecured notes and zero-coupon debt to adjust its funding mix and capital structure. Alongside these balance sheet moves, Citigroup is reshaping its operations through leadership hires in Japan equity capital markets and prime services, aiming to sharpen its institutional and capital markets franchises globally.
